alert.note: Alert for Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 12:06AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Osage and Pawnee Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1205 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Sooner Lake to 2 miles southwest of Perry. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Pawnee... Hominy... Cleveland... Jennings... Ralston... Westport... Osage... Hallett... Blackburn... Terlton... Maramec... Skedee... Walnut Creek State Park... Sooner Lake... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
